thread.title: Faulkner roundup: State tennis, CCS volleyball, CBC golf and Greenbrier volleyball
thread.title_full: Faulkner roundup: State tennis, CCS volleyball, CBC golf and Greenbrier volleyball

author: David McCollum
title: Faulkner roundup: State tennis, CCS volleyball, CBC golf and Greenbrier volleyball
text:
Faulkner roundup: State tennis, CCS volleyball, CBC golf and Greenbrier volleyball Posted: October 20, 2015 - 8:59pm By David McCollum LOG CABIN STAFF WRITER 
Several Faulkner County tennis players had success on the opening day Monday of state high school tennis tournaments. 
The top effort came from Conway Christian’s Mary-Morgan Ellis and Macey Vaught, who reached the Class 2A semifinals at the Fort Smith Athletic Club with a 6-0, 6-1 victory in the quarterfinals over Hampton’s Maddison Jones and Grace Patterson. 
7A at Memorial Park, Bentonville: In boys singles, Conway’s Adam Barnett lost in the quarterfinals, 6-4, 6-2, to Trevor Maddox of Fayetteville. In girls doubles, Alexis Rogers and Holly Jones of Conway lost to Addie Lewis and Maddie McKinney of Rogers, 6-2, 6-1. 
5A at Rebsamen Tennis Center, Little Rock: Josh Himes of Vilonia lost in the first round, 7-6, 6-0, to Noah Ross of Hot Springs Lakeside. In boys doubles, Luke Morgan and Blake Woolridge defeated the Greenbrier team of Huggins and Buckman, 3-6, 6-2, 6-2, in the quarterfinals. Andrew Morgan and Henry Hill of Lakeside defeated Caleb and Jacob Baker of Vilonia in the quarterfinals. In girls singles, Caroline Hatley of Pulaski Academy defeated Charlie Short of Greenbrier, 6-4, 7-5, in the quarterfinals. 
2A at Fort Smith: In girls doubles, McKenna Beach and Bailey Fisher of Riverside defeated Katherine Huff and Allison Oliver of CCS in the first round, 6-0. 6-4. CCS VOLLEYBALL 
ROSE BUD — In its first year under coach Courtney Duever, the Conway Christian volleyball team clinched a state berth and advanced to the semifinals of the 3A-Central tournament with a 25-16, 25-22, 25-20 victory over Mayflower. CBC GOLF 
PANAMA CITY, Fla. — Central Baptist College golfers stand third going into Wednesday’s final round of the National Christian College Athletic Association golf tournament at Hombre Golf Club. CBC (616) trails Dallas Baptist (600) and Colorado Christian (606). Austin Harmon of CBC is fourth individually at 5-over 149. Garrett Bailey of Immanuel College leads at 146. 
Other CBC scores: Tyler Pinney and Luke Cornett, T16, 156 and Cameron Ressor, T35, 164. GREENBRIER VOLLEYBALL 
Greenbrier’s volleyball team (16-9, 7-6) lost matches to Little Rock Christian and Harrison last week. 
LR Christian won, 25-23, 25-17, 25-15. Katherine Jeane had nine kills, Jaylee Engelkes seven and Jaylee Engelkes six. Kobie Hartman had 16 assists. Carrie Jo Harville and Emily Moore were defensive standouts. Greenbrier won the JV match, 28-26, 25-23. Paxton Miller had nine kills and Hollis Redden, 21 assists. 
Harrison won, 26-25, 20-25, 25-9, 25-20. Langston had 11 kills and five aces. Hartman added 20 assists and three aces. Jeane had 11 kills. Maranda Clendinin was a defensive standout. Harrison won the JV match 25-20, 25-16. Miller had four kills.
